creator: vasiliy.gagin@gmail.com
text:
I generate requests from 3 linux boxes using 100 threads on each and 500 iterations.
One would expect to have 3*100*500=150000 samples generated, but I have 1% to 5%
less.
I traced the problem down to RMI layer. RMI creates to many connections to
server (1 per sample?). Some of these connection are getting rejected due to "no
file descriptors" and samples are getting lost.

I would propose to create custom protocol for remote server, logically JMeter
needs only one TCP connection to server.

creator: sebb@apache.org
text:
Are the RMI errors reported in any of the jmeter.log files? If not, it seems to 
me the first stage should be to ensure that these errors are logged.

By the way, I think there is probably one RMI connection established for each 
Listener in the test plan, so you may be able to work around the problem by 
removing as many listeners as possible.

[Otherwise, you can always use 3 independent non-GUI jobs and combine the 
output files for further analysis]

May I suggest you start a discussion on the JMeterDev mailing list regarding 
your plans for the custom protocol?

creator: sebb@apache.org
text:
There was a bug whereby the client closed the result log file when the first remote server test ended, thereby losing any samples that were still to be sent by other serverss.

Assuming that was the problem, there's no need to generate a new protocol.
